        Some angels were not content with this higher order, level-two spiritual intercourse amongst their own kind,
however. Some angels left Heaven to procreate with human women on Earth in level-one sex. One reason these angels
left their heavenly abode to have a lower form of sex was so that they could procreate, something that was not possible
for them at their level-two rung. They wanted to produce offspring in their own image and, in doing so, created hybrid
offspring that corrupted the human genome.
        We are only to have sex with those of our kind on the same rung of the sexual ladder. Animals are not only to
have sex only with animals, but only with their own kind of animal. Similarly, humans are only to have sex with their
kind of humans, that is, at the same rung of the ladder. A human in a glorified body would not have sex with a human in
a normal body. They are at different rungs of the ladder. A glorified human is above angels; an unglorified human is
below angels. Humans have been made a little lower than the angels for a little while (Heb 2:7,9). But when humans are
transformed into their glorified state and become co-rulers with Christ, they will assume bodies, abilities, and positions
superior to the angels. Thus mode-1 humans (M1H) are below angels, while mode-2 humans (M2H) are above angels.
Level-Three Sex
        During the course of my research, when I first read about astral sex, I wondered if resurrected believers might at
least be able to have that spiritual form of sex devoid of physical sex with their former spouses in Heaven. For I assumed
that physical intimacy would be ruled out. Apparently, I was wrong on both accounts. Consistency of pattern would
mandate that overcomers in resurrected bodies would have a level-three sexual experience for at least three reasons.
        First, since M1H will be restored to having both level-one and level-two sex, and since M2H will be at a higher
level on the sexual ladder, it stands to reason that M2H will have a superior level of sex, thus level-three sex. Since M1H
will have both level-one and level-two sex, we must necessarily infer that M2H will have level-three sex.42 Second, this
postulation is also supported by the fact that overcomers will be superior to angels. Since angels have level-two sex, the
most natural assumption is that overcomers will have level-three sex, since their capabilities and experiences will be
higher than that of angels. Third, overcomers will receive glorified bodies that are a combination of their physical and
spiritual bodies. If they already are having level-two sex during the intermediate state in their spiritual state before being
enjoined with their resurrected physical bodies, then the addition of their physical bodies via the resurrection would
logically imply a higher level of sex, namely, a level-three sex that is a combination of level-one and level-two sex. In
short, level-three sex is a combination of level-one and level-two sex: 1 + 2 = 3.

mystic ecstasy will be in this new body.” M2H will be able to enjoin level-one and level-two sex into a singular in-

        Level-one lovemaking is intended, even in this life, to be a reward: “Enjoy life with the woman whom you love

        Unfortunately, like everyone else under the sun, Kreeft waffles and at least allows the imagery entertained by
Lewis as a theoretical possibility. He starts by saying, “I think there will probably be millions of more adequate ways to
express love than the clumsy ecstasy of fitting two bodies together like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle. Even the most satisfying

       not eat candy during intercourse: there is something much better to do. The question of intercourse in
       Heaven is like the child’s question whether you can eat candy during intercourse: a funny question only

       pleasure so intense that it renders candy irrelevant? Only if you know both can you compare.47

       I am not convinced that the logic of Kreeft’s argument allows this concession to Lewis as a realistic expectation.
Certainly, as a theorist I can appreciate the theoretical possibility. Even from that perspective, however, I would point
out that Kreeft acknowledges: “Now we cannot desire something that we in no way know, something that in no way
appears in our experience” (p. 185). Children experientially know the pleasure of candy, but they do not experientially
know the pleasure of physical intercourse. So naturally, according to Kreeft, Marrow, Lewis, and all those following
Lewis down that rabbit hole, children cannot be expected to desire the latter over the former. Yet these same theologians
are asking us to desire the latter over the former, heavenly intimacy over physical intimacy, all the while unwittingly
acknowledging that we cannot!
       For example, Alcorn aptly states: “We cannot desire what we can’t imagine.”48 He applies this statement to space
and time to prove that we cannot desire a Heaven devoid of the two:

               People imagine they’re making Heaven sound wondrous when they say there’s no space and time
       there....In fact, they make Heaven sound utterly alien and unappealing. We don’t want to live in a
       realm...that’s devoid of space and time any more than a fish wants to live in a realm without water. If fish
       could think, try telling one, “When you die, you’ll go to fish Heaven and—isn’t this great?—there will be
       no water! You won’t have fins, and you won’t swim. And you won’t eat because you won’t need food. I’ll
       bet you can’t wait to get there!”...no wonder we and our children don’t get excited about Heaven.49

      Alcon proves a splendid argument and analogy. Even so, the same argument can be made about Lewis’ candy
explanation regarding sex in Heaven. In the following redo of the quote from Alcorn, I will replace his statements

continuation and fulfillment of sexual desires.
        Secondly, this well-intended but short-sited contrast between candy and sex makes the unwarranted conclusion
that you cannot have both at the same time. To the contrary, candy and sex can be mixed together, and some adults do
just that! Allowing the possibility that level-one and level-two sex can be enjoined into single level-three experience
would suffice to disallow Kreeft’s concession to Lewis. My level-three proposition could be content with that possibility.
        Or, if sex at these levels can be separated, you could eat your candy and then later have intercourse, so to speak.
However, the argument herein implements Kreeft’s own acknowledgement that the highest degrees of ecstasy will be in
our resurrected body so as to conclude that the highest level of sexual intimacy possible between compatible kindred
souls cannot be a level-two spiritual intercourse associated with out-of-body experiences. Logical consistency dictates
that the highest level of sexual intimacy possible between compatible kindred souls, and which thus most closely
approximates the even higher level of intimacy that we can have with God, necessarily involves our resurrected physical
bodies. Kreeft’s own arguments against dualism and for in-body ecstasy prohibit us from dividing physical intercourse
from spiritual intercourse among compatible kindred soulmates who have resurrected bodies when they are seeking the
highest forms of ecstasy available to them.50
        Marrow and Kreeft are inconsistent when they allow the impossibility posed by Lewis regarding a sexless Heaven.
Therefore, I will maintain that level-one and level-two sex must be enjoined into a single level-three experience for CCS
intercourse for the simple reason that physical and metaphysical sex cannot be separated when ecstasy within CCSC is
being experienced at its highest level. In other words, my deduction is that, given Kreeft’s own argument, overcomers
not only can have their cake and eat it too, they must have their cake and eat it too! Or to use other imagery, not only can
you have your candy with your intercourse, but you cannot have your intercourse without the candy. You have both or
neither, but not either or. When sex is experienced at its highest level in CCSC, it will not be decoupled from the physical
interaction. In terms of the fish analogy, you must be allowed to keep your fins and use them. Theorizing that compatible
kindred souls might have something much better to do because level-two sex is better than level-one sex is a false
dichotomy, a comparison of apples to oranges, in that, among other things, it fails to consider the possibility that heavenly
lovers might be able to have a level-three sexual experience that combines both level-one and level-two sex into the
highest form of ecstasy available to them at their rung on the ladder, namely a level-three sexual experience, which is
second only to spiritual intercourse with God.
        Sexual ecstasy will be the highest form of pleasure that we can experience in the interpersonal relationship we
have with one another as human beings. To be sure, it is not the highest form of pleasure, as Kreeft correctly concludes.
Spiritual intercourse with God would be a level-four sexuality:

                This spiritual intercourse with God is the ecstasy hinted at in all earthly intercourse, physical or
         spiritual. It is the ultimate reason why sexual passion is so strong, so different from other passions....We
         love the other sex because God loves God....Human sexuality is that image, and human sexuality is a
         foretaste....

50
     Kreeft, 122-123.
Page 26                                                                                          Mongamous Sex in Heaven!
            And this earthly love is so passionate because Heaven is full of passion, of energy and
       dynamism....Earthly sex is the shadow.51 (Emphasis his.)

        Kreeft reasons wrongly, however, when he anticipates that level-four sex with God may make level-three sex with
our soulmate insignificant. Admittedly, level-four sex will be far superior to level-three sex, and the reason we desire
level-one sex so much currently is because we are created in the image of God and thus love the transcendental God-
encounter that we thus experience when we make love to our spouse who is created in the image of God. Level-one sex
is only the shadow of level-four sex. On the other hand, level-one sex is also the shadow of level-three sex. We will not
be sitting around on clouds gazing at God in spiritual ecstasy the whole time for all eternity. That is, we will not be having
a non-stop experience of level-four sex at all times. Eternal sex, yes. Non-stop sex, no. Level-four sex will be the pinnacle
of our heavenly experience. Level-three sex will be just below it. Nevertheless, we will not spend all our time on these
sexual summits. There will be millions of other interesting things to do in Heaven as well. Still, this does not mean that
these other things are better than level-three or level-four sex. Simply, we will find time for all such activities.
                                                     Marriage
       As already indicated, marriage will continue for M1H but die and give birth to a higher form of rulership,
citizenship, and companionship for M2H. My proposition is that marriage will cease for M2H, but the union of a man
with a women will not cease. A corollary of my model, then, is that marriage is more than the union of a man and a
women. Let us look at the first marriage:
       26
          Then God said, “Let us make MAN in our image, according to our likeness; and let them rule over the
       fish of the sea and over the birds of the sky and over the cattle and over all the earth, and over every creeping
       thing that creeps on the earth.” 27 And God created MAN in His own image, in the image of God He created
       HIM; male and female He created them. 28 And God blessed them; and God said to them, “Be fruitful
       and multiply, and fill the earth, and subdue it; and rule over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the
       sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth” (Gen 1:26-28; TM).52

This original union would be understood as a marriage in which Adam and Eve became one flesh:
       21
         So the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, and he slept; then He took one of his ribs, and
       closed up the flesh at that place. 22 And the Lord God fashioned into a woman the rib which He had taken
       from the man, and brought her to the man. 23 And the man said, “This is now bone of my bones, and flesh
       of my flesh; she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.” 24 For this cause a man shall
       leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave to his wife; and they shall become one flesh. 25 And the
       man and his wife were both naked and were not ashamed” (Gen 2:21-25).

  Many translations capitalize Man in Gen 5:2. For example, the NAS reads: “He created them male and female, and He

versus the lower case man for the male Adam are attempting to convey this nuance via the case differentiation.

them ‘humankind’” (NET). Mankind is another option: “He created them male and female, and blessed them and called
them Mankind in the day they were created” (NKJ). Yet in Gen 2:23 translations use either Man or man, not Adam, nor

Adam. For present purposes, I am using the typical rendition of Man for the generic use in Gen 2:23 but adopting

       Jesus would later challenge popular views of divorce on the grounds of this passage: “And He answered and said,
‘Have you not read, that He who created them from the beginning made them male and female, and said, “For this cause
a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh”? Consequently
they are no longer two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate” (Mt 19:4-6; cp.
Mk 10:8-9). Likewise, Paul confirms that this model serves as the foundation for marriage (Eph 5:31). Further, Paul
enjoins believers not to engage in sexual promiscuity with a harlot, for the one who does so becomes one flesh with her,
though they are not married: “Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take away the
members of Christ and make them members of a harlot? May it never be! Or do you not know that the one who joins
himself to a harlot is one body with her? For He says, ‘The two will become one flesh.’” (1Cor 6:15-16). Obviously, the
union of a man with a woman does not intrinsically constitute marriage. This simple observation suffices to prove my
corollary: Marriage is more than the union of a man and a women. Just because a man joins himself with a harlot does
not mean that they are married. Why?
       Well, for starters, God has not joined a man and a harlot together; rather, they have joined themselves together
outside of God’s will. Harlotry is contrary to God’s original design. God brought Adam and Eve together for multiple
purposes. They were to be permanent partners. God’s plan was not merely for them to have sex but to procreate—to
reproduce in their likeness, raising a family that would learn rulership, that is, how to exercise responsible stewardship.
Sex without these goals is not marriage as God designed it. According to the original design, marriage is more than a
license to have sex.

        The heart of Gen 1:26-28 is that we have been created in the image of God as part of a sexual relationship. We are
designed to have one complementary mate. In the passage, rulership is the first peripheral aspect of this relationship;
reproduction is the second. A union that follows the original design and which thus qualifies to be called marriage in the
eternal state must entail all three components: relationship, rulership, and reproduction. All three components must
continue in the eternal state, or Satan will have been successful in frustrating God’s original design for humanity.
Naturally, this does not mean that every human being who ever lived must have all three components. Unbelievers within
hell will not have any of these components, but this does not frustrate God’s original design for humanity as a whole.
Unfaithful believers within the outer darkness will not have any of these components either, but once again God’s design
is not thwarted by their failure either. For God’s design to emerge triumphant, it suffices that humanity, as a species,
continues to have all three components in eternity future. M1H meets that need.
        Given the necessity of these three components, as to what is necessary to constitute biblical marriage as God
intends it, we may deduce that angels in Heaven are not married in that they do not reproduce. Of course, since sex is not
limited to the purpose of reproduction, this does not mean that angels cannot engage in sex. However, this lack of
reproduction among angels means that angels, as a species, cannot be God’s image bearer to the extent that MAN is. To
be like the Creator means that one must be able to create beings in one’s own likeness. Angels cannot; MAN can.
        The Creator can create beings in His own image and likeness. Accordingly, Gen 1:26-28 associates both rulership
and reproduction with what it means to be created in the image of God. Through procreation, MAN, as God’s image
bearer, can create beings in his own image and likeness as well. Indeed, Moses makes this connection:
         1
           This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day when God created MAN, He made HIM in the
         likeness of God. 2 He created them male and female, and He blessed them and named them MAN in the
         day when they were created. 3 When Adam had lived one hundred and thirty years, he became the father
         of a son in his own likeness, according to his image, and named him Seth. (Gen 5:1-3; TM)

        Like Father, like son: God—Adam. Also, like father, like son: Adam—Seth. Adam bore the image of his Father
in being able to create a son in his own image through the God-ordained means of doing so. Some angels have tried to
be like God and create beings in their own image. Yet they have failed, and in doing so they have violated God’s order.
Nephilim are not angels, but half breeds, a lower level of being than angels, a being half angel and half human.53 Being
created in the image of God at the highest level, at least as a species, must entail being able to create sexual beings in
one’s own image. Angels lack this ability. Thus, as a species, they are lacking in their ability to function as God’s image
bearer in this capacity, though they currently function at a higher level than MAN in hierarchy, at least in regard to M1H.
Angels were created in the image of God, to a limited extent, as sexual beings with male and female relationships and
rulership. But lacking the ability to reproduce, they could not be like the Creator as procreators. Humanity as a whole,
then, is superior to angels in this capacity.
        Because humanity is able to reproduce sexually, they are more like God in that capacity than angels. Ironically,
though, this ability places them in the lower physical realm which is but a shadow of the higher spiritual realm. Because
angels are native to this higher spiritual realm, they are superior to humans in that capacity. Even so, humans and angels
function as God’s image bearers in their own realms and capacities. Humans are superior to angels in one aspect, but
lower than angels in another.
        For humanity to continue to function fully as God’s image bearer in their original capacity, human procreation
must continue. As I have demonstrated elsewhere (see TOD and RAE), humanity will continue in this function, as a
species, through M1H. That part of humanity will still reproduce and thus have marital relations. They will also have
rulership over animals, thus exercising a limited form of rulership. Rulership at a higher level, though, that is, over angels,
will be reserved for M2H. Being decoupled from sexual reproduction in the physical realm enables overcomers to
function as couples in a plane of rulership higher than the angels. M2H needs M1H so that the human species, as a whole,
can fulfill the original mandate and pattern. At the same time, M2H needs to be separated from M1H, in the sense of
being lifted above it, so that humanity can rise above angels in hierarchy. That humanity was intended to rise above
angels would be anticipated from humanity being created more fully like the Creator as procreators. The riddle as to how
humanity would be lower than angels (because of the physical limitations imposed by physical procreation) and yet
higher than the angels (because of their procreation) is answered by the two-mode view of humanity. In other words, the
enjoining of reproduction with rulership puts the human relationship above angelic relationships. Nevertheless, the
separation of the reproduction from rulership was also necessary to raise the human relationship above angelic
relationships. How could this tension be resolved?

        From the very beginning, God intended to use the fall to split humanity into two modes so that He might resolve
the dilemma. He hinted at this by forming Eve from Adam’s body. From misthology, we have known for years that
Adam’s body represents the church and that Eve’s body represents the church of the firstborn brought forth by the out-
resurrection: subcomers versus overcomers in other words. The advanced misthological perception being argued herein
is that at an even deeper misthological level Adam’s body represents subcomers of all ages, not just the church age, and
Eve’s body represents overcomers of all ages, not just the church age. The most glorious parts of Eve’s bridal body would
be composed of church-age believers, nevertheless. Misthological ranking of parts of the Bridal body is already known
to be applicable to church-age believers. Not every church age overcomer will have equal glory. The new proposition is
simply moving one step further and applying the same principle to all overcomers.
        Pattern and typology suggests that you can no more function as a ruler without a sexual counterpart than you can
function as a procreator without a mate. Even Jesus, as Man, will not rule without His consort queen, the Bride. Adam
could not rule without Eve. Numerically and typologically, this would have been impossible. Adam and Eve had to
procreate so that humanity could spread over the face of the cosmos in order to rule the cosmos. Procreation was a
necessary means to planetary rulership. This logical relationship between procreation and rulership is established in
Gen 1:26-28. Procreation is not optional. Procreation is a means to an end—rulership. Rulership enjoined with
procreation is likewise the means to an even higher end—functioning as God’s image bearer—being like God.
        When Satan deceptively offered Eve the opportunity to “be like God” (Gen 3:5), he unwittingly spoke the truth
and in doing so brought about his own demise—subjugation to MAN. Unfallen Adam and Eve were only M1H. Satan
was not subject to Adam and Eve. M1H was created at a level lower than the angels (Heb 2:5-18; Ps 8:4-8). This physical
universe was to be under the rulership of M1H, but the angelic realm was not put in subjection to M1H. For humanity to
rise above the angels, humanity would need to rise to a new level, a higher level—M2H. MAN had to fall so that MAN
might rise to greater heights as a result of falling and being raised to new heights—the right hand of God (Heb 1:3,13;
8:1; 10:12; 12:2). Simplistically, one might say that M1H had to fall so that M2H might rise to greater heights than angels.
Without the fall, MAN could not have risen to these heights. God is the Master Designer, and He designed a hierarchy.
MAN was created lower than the angels. Thus MAN, as the lower ranking creature, could not reign over angels. God
allowed the fall so that He might split MAN into two modes of humanity: one below the angels, the other above the
angels. Not only is MAN higher than angels in the enjoining of a M2 male (M2M) with a M2 female (M2F) but also in
the enjoining of M1H with M2H.54 Literal and typological sex is key in both unions.55 To deny the literal sexual union
of either M1H or M2H is to miss not only the typological significance but the logical requisite.
        Frankly, it is unlikely that there will be any eternal bachelors or bachelorettes in either M1H or M2AH in the
eternal state. Conversely, all those in the outer darkness (M2BH) would be eternal bachelors or bachelorettes, that is,
lonely in terms of sexual companionship. Nonetheless, they are part of the body—Adam’s body—and will be ministered
to by their bridal mate—Eve’s body—at the cooperate level.
        Procreation was necessary so that humanity would spread out over the area to be ruled. Filling the Earth was a
necessary prerequisite to ruling the Earth. A solidary human being ruling over a planet is not the picture of that design.
The planet being ruled must be populated with human beings. Likewise, the galaxies, universe, and multiverse must
eventually be populated by humanity in eternity future in order for the mandate to find fulfillment.
        I have come to the point in my marriage where I can offer a simple definition for abundant life as having a Christian
wife and say, “Jesus loves me this I know for Dianne shows me so.” If the greatest tangible expression that I currently
have of the Lord’s love for me in my day-by-day experience is found in the arms of my mate, in a God-loving-God union,
to use Kreeft’s insight, why should I think that the Lord will dissolve that union when I reach Heaven? Would He not
instead make that union even greater so that I can experience that intimacy at an even higher level in Heaven and thereby
experience the love of God in ways that would otherwise be impossible? If designs matter to the Designer, and I have
every right to think that they do, then why should I think that He will rip up His original design and concede defeat to
Satan? To the contrary, God anticipated Satan’s folly and planned to redeem His design and make it even better. The
hints that He would do so were already embedded in the riddle of the original design.
        I recognize that it is God’s love being expressed through my wife for me and that my love for my wife is an
expression of God’s love for her, just as I sang to her at our wedding: “The love inside my heart today is more than mine
alone...and by the God who gives it...the life and love He’s given us are never going to die.” Praise God for the love He

                                                Deification and Angelification
       In discussing how MAN will be like God and angels, Michael Heiser implements various texts and synonymous
theological terms (e.g., deification, divinization, theosis, glorification, and angelification).57 One can search for these
terms on the internet to find the standard texts used in this regard. From Dan 12:2-3 and 1Cor 6:2, for example, we may
deduce that M2AH will shine brightly like stars and outrank all angels—not just fallen ones (Heb 2:5). We know from
the Lord Jesus that resurrected believers will be like angels in certain regards. From the creation account, we know that
MAN was created to be like God. Actually, from the creation account we know that MAN was created to be like God
and angels. One can see Heiser for an extended discussion, and we will turn to that discussion, in part, later. For now,
though, I would call attention to a text that combines both motifs and two modes of humanity: “In that day the Lord will
defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; the one who is feeble among them in that day shall be like David [M1H—and perhaps
M2BH?], and the house of David shall be like God [M2AH], like the Angel of the Lord before them” (Zech 12:8; NKJ).
A basic differentiation in two classes of believers is apparent. In the millennium, those physically feeble believers who
survive until the end of the tribulation will enter into the millennial state in M1H physical bodies and be able to reproduce.
Perhaps the verse also allows the possibility that the morally feeble will be like David in having a strong warrior body,
nevertheless, falling short of the greatest OT warrior—the Angel of the Lord. In contrast, overcomers will be like God in
that they will be like the Angel of the Lord. They will be like God and like this particular angel, but this angel is none
other than the second person of the Trinity, the visible manifestation of Yahweh in angelic form, the Lord Jesus Christ.
Thus those glorified believers who inherit the kingdom will be like this Angel-God, that is, like the Lord Jesus. Does this
mean that they will all be males? No! Female overcomers will shine like stars but retain their feminine form. MAN will
be like angels, and female overcomers will be like female angels. MAN will also be like God. Glorified overcomers will
be angelic gods and goddesses. This conclusion has biblical and extrabiblical support, as we will see.58
                                                        Conclusion
       Believers should be encouraged to be faithful regarding both level-one and level-two sex in the reasonable
anticipation that they can expect to earn level-three sex. They should be encouraged to be faithful regarding physical and
metaphysical sex in the realistic expectation of acquiring misthological sex. Even though theoreticians might speculate
that the possibility of something better than misthological sex renders sex insignificant, such theoretical conjectures
should be dismissed as inconsistent and irrelevant to the rational misthological hope of CCSC. Furthermore, such
theoretical speculations, which suppose that physical sex will become irrelevant in Heaven, could prove harmful, indeed
very detrimental.
       Believers addicted to pornography, for example, might find the extra motivation they need to overcome their
addiction if they had solid reason to believe that they would acquire a higher level of sexual satisfaction in Heaven by
overcoming their earthly sexual addiction. The same holds true for believers tempted with immorality and adultery. They
already have been warned that not inheriting the kingdom is at stake—something that they may care very little about. So
let them also be warned and encouraged in terms of something that they care very dearly about—sex. In the CCS model,
a higher level of sexual pleasure awaits those believers who are faithful sexually. Thus this model should be extolled not
only because it is sound doctrine but also for pragmatic reasons.
       As far as believers who are contemplating or engaging in level-two sex now, a stern warning must be given. Do
not seek spiritual sex now. Some Christians are engaging in metaphysical sex now in the astral plane, to their own ruin.
Astral sex is spiritual immorality that opens one up to spiritual rape and possession by demonic entities. Even if those
dangers are successfully avoided, astral sex still has the potential to disqualify a believer from having physical,
metaphysical, and misthological sex in Heaven for all eternity. Even seeking to have spiritual sex limited to one’s own

spouse during the present is off limits. We should not seek this out-of-body experience with our spouse now. Presently,
we are to be content with physical sex with our spouse. As a reward for our sexual chastity, in which we limit our sexual
experiences to the biblical limits currently imposed upon us, we may reasonably look forward to having misthological
sex in Heaven for all eternity. So do not forfeit eternal third-level sex in the third Heaven for a few fleeting years of sinful
level-two sex in the second heaven. For those who need a more graphic warning, picture being bound in the outer darkness
as being locked in a chastity belt—forever (cp. Mt 22:13). Is temporally abusing level-one and level-two sex really worth
missing out on level-three sex eternally?
       The positive advantages of this model are applicable to believers at all aspects of the matrimonial spectrum. It
provides encouragement for those who are:

           •    Happily Married
           •    Unhappily Married
           •    Newly Married
           •    Unmarried
           •    Remarried

Naturally, this model has the positive benefit of comforting the bereaved. Let those widows and widowers who have lost
their spouses be encouraged that their hope of sexual intimacy with their departed loved ones is a reasonable expectation,
if they have been faithful both to one another and to the Lord. Additionally, this CCS model encourages those who are
not yet married or who are newly married—but who are having difficulty looking forward to the rapture for fear of
forfeited sexual intimacy—that the best is yet to come. The fear of missing out on level-one sex in the present or of letting
go of level-one sex is groundless when you have eternal level-three sex as a confident expectation in the future. As to
those who are unhappily married, they will not be stuck with their current spouse for eternity. This model stipulates that
the desire for companionship must be mutually consensual.
       On the other hand, neither unfaithful believers nor unbelievers will qualify as suitable companions even if both
parties desire the union. For example, if a faithful believer is married to an unfaithful husband, then they will not be
suitable CCSs even if they both desire to soulmates in Heaven. For one thing, she will be living in the Heavenly City, but
he will be barred from the Heavenly City. He cannot live with her in the City, and she will not want to live with him in
the outer darkness. She cannot have her earthly husband as her eternal soulmate in that case. But she is not left out in the
dark, in terms of CCS. The character she will have developed in learning how to love her earthly spouse will carry over
into enriching her love for her new CCS partner. Additionally, there is no reason that she cannot take her new heavenly
soulmate down memory lane and show, and even experientially share, those special moments in her earthly pilgrimage
with her new mate. For one thing, overcomers will be able to do experiential time travel. They can go back and relive, to
a certain degree, those special experiences with their new spouse. Or they might simply share a life review with them in
which they both go back and experience those thoughts and emotions in a manner suggested by NDErs (since this is
described as actually happening in NDEs now) or in sci-fi by something analogous to a Vulcan mind melt. She will be
able to share everything in her past with her new soulmate that she desires, and he will be able to share everything in his
past with her that he desires. Her memories and his memories will become shared memories—their memories.
Overcomers are not going to have to start from scratch if they enjoin themselves to a new mate. They can share as much
or as little of their previous life with their new mate as they desire. They will both still burst forth like butterflies from
cocoons in their abilities to commingle at the physical and spiritual levels.
        Our desire and ability to express personal love to our mates should be greater, not lesser, in Heaven. Undoubtedly,
we will have millions of things to do in Heaven. Still, we will find time to enjoy level-four sex with God. Why not allow
that we will also find time to have level-three sex with our heavenly soulmate? The angels who were in Heaven and yet
who fell because of their unbridled sexual desire are proof that being with God and having a lot of interesting things to
do in Heaven do not dampen one’s sexual desire. Unlike them, though, our sexual desires will be bridled, limited to our
sole soulmate. We will be incapable of sinful desires, not incapable of sensual desires. Eating is a sensual desire, yet we
will still have stomachs and corresponding appetites. This does not mean that we will spend all our time eating, but it
does mean that we will take time to eat. Likewise, we will have sexual organs and corresponding sexual appetites. This
does not mean that we will spend all our time having sex, but it does indicate that we will take time to have sex.
Notwithstanding, the strongest evidence that we will have sexual desire is the fact that we will still be in the image of
God. We will love experiencing God’s love in our love making to one another. If you reject this model, then so be it. But
do so because you have a stronger argument, not because you have a weaker one.

        The only reasonable conclusion, then, is that procreation must continue for M1H. Their M1 lovemaking will result
in the procreation of the human species, which is necessary for the rulership of the multiverse. On the other hand, M2A
lovemaking will not be tied directly to procreation, in that M2AH will not be the physical procreators of the expanding
human race. Nevertheless, the procreation by M1H will result in expanding rulership for M2AH. Although not resulting
in procreation, the lovemaking by M2AH will have multiple positive purposes, the foremost of which is to understand
and experience God’s love in a way that otherwise would be impossible. As for the third category, M2B believers will
still experience God’s love, of course. But they will miss out on experiencing it at the heights of ecstasy being experienced
by those sharing God’s love in lovemaking. In that regard, M2BH will be left out in the dark—the outer darkness.
                                         Illustration 21. The Heart of the Matter




       The male-female union is pervasive throughout the Gen 1:26-28 passage. At all three levels (i.e., reproduction,
rulership, and relationship), this male-female coupling is intended in the original design. The highest purpose for this
intimacy is to experience and express the loving unity of the Creator. Level-one reproductive sex is a taste of this intimacy
and will be experienced throughout eternity by M1H. Co-ruling together with the Creator as couples will give a higher
experience of such intimacy and will be experienced at various degrees by both M1H and M2AH. Thus, in the illustration,
two couples are pictured as standing on this rulership level, though the M1H is pictured as smaller in stature. But even
greater still, level-three lovemaking and enjoying our soulmate relationship will be the highest ecstasy that M2A couples
can mutually share, short of stepping through the door to one-on-one intimacy with the Creator Himself in level-four
ecstasy. If our earthly experience foreshadows our heavenly experience, which is what we biblically would expect, then
this exegetical deduction has been anticipated already by our day-by-day reality. Earth is the training ground for the
heavenly reality. M2BH believers who experience the rejection of the outer darkness will have eternity for reflection
upon what might have been, if they had just been faithful. To be sure, those misthologically rejected will still have some
childish level of intimacy with the Creator, as is befitting children who can only experience chocolate and are unable to
move on to more mature forms of pleasure.
                                        Chapter 2.
                                 Experiential Confirmation
                                                         Introduction
       If the hypotheses being advocated herein are correct, one would expect to find some limited confirmation among
those claiming to have experiences of the intermediate state. Although the principle thesis herein is regarding the
resurrected state, and thus not subject to present experiential confirmation or contradiction, secondary theses have been
entertained as to the possibility of a limited sexual intimacy being experienced by soulmates during the intermediate
state. While the absence of present conformational data might not be enough to disprove my overall thesis, the presence
of such conformational data would practically prove my primary thesis. Surely, if sexual intimacy exists in the
intermediate state, it will exist in the eternal state also. On the other hand, my secondary arguments notwithstanding,
sexual intimacy might have to await our resurrected bodies. Experiential data would help to verify whether or not this is
the case. In any case, the predictive value of my model is subject to at least some experiential confirmation via such
information, which makes for good science. Extrabiblical dreams, visions, and NDEs may, therefore, be appropriately
considered in a secondary and conformational capacity regarding my secondary theses, now that the exegetical
expectation has been laid.
                                                 Joni Eareckson Tada
     Adopting somewhat a similar approach, Joni Eareckson Tada combines experience with exegesis in her book,
Heaven, and starts off the second chapter of her book with an exceptionally vivid dream that she is convinced accurately
communicates truths about Heaven:

              I’ve been thinking about my heavenly home for years. Naturally, you can understand why: My
      earthly body doesn’t work. That’s one reason I dream about heaven all the time.
              I can’t say my dreams are Technicolor versions of pearly gates and streets of gold; rather, they’re
      more like rough sketches or dim reflections, as when my “eyes...see the king in his beauty and view a land
      that stretches afar” (Isaiah 33:17). Like the roiling vista of a Kansas wheat field...
              ...Except for one extraordinary heaven dream I had one night in a hotel in Stavanger, Norway. My
      quiet time that week centered on Revelation 21:21 where it says, “the great street of the city was of pure
      gold, like transparent glass.” It didn’t make sense. Gold is not transparent; and it’s nothing like glass
      because you can’t see through it. It was another one of those heavenly images gone gawky. I shrugged my
      shoulders and closed my Bible.
              That night, as the cold Norwegian Wind rattled my bedroom window, I snuggled down and slipped
      into the most amazing dream. I saw myself standing in a bright yellow bathing suit at the edge of a pool.
      This was astonishing since I rarely dream about being on my feet. Usually I can’t see or feel my body from
      the shoulders down; my torso and legs are always hazy and unfinished, like the half-completed edges of a
      painting. But not in this dream.
              I stretched my arms above my head, arched my back, and gracefully dove into the water. When I
      came up and slicked my hair with my hands, I was stunned to see them glow, all rose-red wet and honey-
      ivory, bathed in life, beauty, and well-being. I pressed my palms to my nose. They smelled wild and sweet.
      Some might have mistaken me for an angel, but I never felt more human, more a woman. I cocked my
      head and admired my outstretched arms and then looked around. This is hard to describe, but the water and
      air were brilliant, ablaze in light, like pure gold, as transparent as glass.
              Each breath was piercing to my lungs, but with a sweet sting that made me want to breathe deeper.
      I looked down to see the pool water shimmering like diamonds. You know how we say “the water
      sparkles”? In my dream it was doing exactly that. The air was sparkling too. Everything was flashing, clear,
      and golden.
              I saw a friend sitting poolside, relaxing in a chair under a white cabana and watching me. Oddly, he
      looked awash in light too. He seemed more real, more a man than ever before. He was my old friend but
      a thousand times more himself, and when our eyes met, youth infused my heart. I wondered if he felt the
      same. I smiled, waved, and then began swimming, smoothly parting the water with long, powerful strokes.
      The ripples felt cool and slick, more like satin than water. After a while, my friend dove in. He touched my
      shoulder and it burned, but in a painless way. There was no need to talk; our smiles said that we were
      friends for the first time again. We swam together stroke-for-stroke. And the longer we swam, the stronger
      we grew. Not weaker, but stronger.
Page 34                                                                                          Mongamous Sex in Heaven!
                It was the most remarkable dream I’ve ever had. When I woke up, I had no doubt. It was a dream
         about heaven. I was convinced “pure gold like transparent glass” existed. It wasn’t a gawky image. I saw it
         with the eyes of my heart.59

        She had been reading about what Heaven would be like during the eternal state. Apparently, God gave her a
glimpse of that reality via a dream in which she was “more a woman” and her friend was “more a man” than they ever
had been during their earthly lives. Evidently, she was given a preview of her glorified, resurrected body and likewise of
her friend’s glorified, resurrected body in the eternal state, and she found their bodies more feminine and masculine than
ever before. The impression she had was that their sexuality was fully intact. They were not physically neuter.
        Contrastively, some NDErs are reporting that during the intermediate state they retain their gender but lack internal
organs and external sexual genitalia. This may indeed be true during the intermediate state; however, it will not be true
in the resurrected state, when we have glorified bodies. Our physical bodies will then be united with our spiritual bodies
into glorified bodies and thus have corresponding physical and sexual organs. Jesus uses this type of reasoning to prove
to His disciples that He had been raised from the dead:
         36
            And while they were telling these things, He Himself stood in their midst. 37 But they were startled and
         frightened and thought that they were seeing a spirit. 38 And He said to them, “Why are you troubled, and
         why do doubts arise in your hearts? 39 “See My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself; touch Me and see,
         for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see that I have.” 40 And when He had said this, He
         showed them His hands and His feet. 41 And while they still could not believe it for joy and were marveling,
         He said to them, “Have you anything here to eat?” 42 And they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish; 43 and
         He took it and ate it before them. (Lk 24:36-43)

        Bones are a part of our internal physical makeup, of course. Those in mere spiritual bodies do not have bones, at
least not physical bones. For Tada to arch her back certainly suggests a backbone. Therefore, I take it that she was not in
a spiritual body, but in a resurrected body. Likewise, Jesus ate the fish, which obviously indicates that He did more than
just chew it. He swallowed it. Where did it go? To His stomach, of course. His eating the fish points to the presence of
internal organs. But if He had internal organs in this resurrected physical body, then surely He had external organs also,
specifically male genitalia. In fact, earlier in Luke, when Jesus was transfigured, we should make the same deduction:
“And while He was praying, the appearance of His face became different, and His clothing became white and gleaming.
And behold, two males (aner) were talking with Him; and they were Moses and Elijah” (Lk 9:29-30; TM). Surely, Jesus
did not lose His internal or external organs when He was transfigured. Are we to believe that one minute He was standing
there with sexual genitalia, then the next moment He is transfigured and emasculated so as to lose His genitalia, then He
returns to being fully male with genitalia intact a few moments later? Posing such transgender fluctuation is ludicrous.
For that matter, Luke specifies that Moses and Elijah appeared to Him in male form. Luke also specifies that they were
appearing in glory (Lk 9:31). Apparently, like Jesus, they had glorified male bodies. One is left to presume that they had
glorified physical bodies complete with male genitalia, even during their intermediate state.
        Returning now to Tada, she finds the air she is breathing to be exhilarating, as each breath pierces her lungs. My
natural inclination is to consider this a description of her resurrected body. But I could be wrong. NDErs describe the air
in Heaven as being filled with the aroma of flowers, and some NDErs describe taking penetrating breaths that go down
deep into their lungs. Even though one NDEr, in describing his experience of Heaven, says that there is no air there, such
a claim is refuted by the testimony of others. Perhaps those in the intermediate state can take deep breaths that go down
deep into their lungs. If so, perhaps Tada could be describing an intermediate experience, my assumptions about bones
notwithstanding.

       If his vision is legitimate, then it might be taken as an explicit experiential affirmation of my model with the minor
exception that he proposes that those who are not happily married will not search for a CCS but be given one by God,
just as Eve was given to Adam by God. In other words, he believes that God is the matchmaker. There will be no
www.HeavenlySoulMates.com so-to-speak, which I am using as possibility to represent our freewill opportunity to find
a compatible soulmate. Having two good competing models is better than just having one good model. So, as a scientist
exploring hermeneutical possibilities, I am open to this competing possibility. Hetrick did not attribute his theory to
heavenly information but to biblical typology. I can do the same. The Bride of Christ must consent to be His Bride of her

60
     Patrick Doucette. Is Heaven for Real? Personal Stories of Visiting Heaven (Kindle, 2013), 132-143.
Chapter 2. Experiential Confirmation                                                                               Page 37
own free will. Likewise, I would pose that those in the Heavenly City who are initially unmated, because they did not
have a pre-existing qualified soulmate to whom they were happily married on Earth, will be free to find a suitable
soulmate in Heaven. Still, it would seem eminently reasonable that God has designed a suitable soulmate for each person
inhabiting the City. On that matter, I would agree with Hetrick. The only question is how much control God will exert in
bringing them together. Will He allow them to find each other indirectly, or will He bring them together directly, or will
He sometimes do one and at other times do the other? Maybe part of the excitement of Heaven is the anticipation and not
being able to answer that question definitively at present.
        As it is, the vital parts of his testimony regarding companionship are scripturally sound. Biblical marriage is
certainly connected with reproduction. What Jesus was denying was sexual relations for the purpose of reproduction for
those who are resurrected. He was not denying sexual companionship. That the resurrected would not be capable of
reproduction is a logical corollary of the resurrected being raised from the dead, never to die again, because they have
immortal bodies that are not subject to any form of death. As discussed elsewhere in my writings, Dillow is correct that
reproduction is impossible apart from some forms of physical death. He wrongly thought, though, that this means that
procreation cannot continue in the eternal state. To the contrary, procreation does continue in the eternal state for M1H.
Procreation does not, and cannot, continue in the eternal state for M2H. Resurrected believers are like angels in that
regard. M2H cannot die; therefore, they cannot physically reproduce. When Jesus said that M2H cannot die anymore, He
gave us the information necessary to deduce that resurrected believers cannot reproduce physically. Hence, they do not
marry.
        We may also extrapolate the logical inference that the resurrected do not procreate physically to conclude that this
means that the resurrected do not procreate spiritually either. Thus they do not procreate at all. Exclusively spiritual
beings create; they do not procreate. We learn this from the very beginning. “God said, “Let us make MAN in our
image...so God created MAN in His own image” (Gen 1:26-27; TM). The members of the Trinity did not procreate in
order to make MAN. They created MAN. They did not procreate MAN. Creation, not procreation, was their means of
making MAN. Then God commanded MAN to procreate, that is, “to be fruitful and multiply.” Procreation was unique
to the physical creation. Angels were created in the image of God as spiritual beings. Like God, as spiritual beings, they
lacked the ability to procreate. Unlike God, they did not have the ability to create an image in their own image, however.
They could not take a piece of clay and make an image in their own likeness. They were lacking in the godlike ability to
produce images in their own likeness. God gave this ability to the lower creature, MAN, by making him part of the
physical creation, and thus a part of the aspect of creation capable of reproduction. Just as God the Creator is at the top
of the spiritual order, so He created MAN at the top of the physical order. While God could create images in His own
likeness, MAN could procreate images in his own likeness. The only way angels could attempt to create or procreate
images in their own likeness was to hijack the procreative abilities of MAN and merge them with their own creative
abilities. But in doing so, angels produced an abomination. Their attempt to be more like God than what their created
order would allow was a part of their downfall.
        Even if Hedrick’s claim to have visited Heaven so many times is genuine, and I will allow that possibility, it still
fails to give explicit experiential confirmation of my model, however, even though it agrees with my model fully. If you
notice carefully, he fails to state how his experiences in Heaven confirm that what he is saying is true. He fails to state,
for example, that he saw people in Heaven having the type sexual companionship that he is describing. He states that
God showed him a very beautiful lady in Heaven and that he desired her as a companion, obviously for sexual reasons.
This testimony would be experiential confirmation of sexual desires in Heaven. Nonetheless, his other statements could
merely be logical inferences drawn from the biblical text itself rather than based on visual observations or verbal
confirmations of what he actually experienced in Heaven. His statements, as given, are little more than a confirming
opinion of my model by someone who claims to be very well informed. On the other hand, if he actually had eighty visits
to Heaven, then one may reasonably suppose that he may have had other experiences not recorded in this brief interview
that confirm what he is saying, but rather than delve into those unsustainable experiences, he appeals to Scripture to
demonstrate the reasonableness of his case. The jury is still out, therefore, as to just how much credibility to give the
experiential conformational value of his testimony, though the exegetical value of his collaboration is certainly well
received.

      Sigmund says that the women in Heaven are beautiful: “Just a few feet from me, I could see two women standing.
Somehow, I knew that they were of great age, but their countenances were like they were in their mid-twenties, and they
were beautiful.”63 He got to observe this transformation to youthful beauty take place on another occasion:

              At that moment, an old, wrinkled woman, all stoop-shouldered and very frail, came through the veil.
      Instantly upon entering the atmosphere of heaven, she snapped completely straight—her frail, stooped-over
      body became just as straight as could be. Suddenly, she was once again a beautiful young woman, dressed
      in her radiant, pure white robe of glory. (p. 19)

      Later, Sigmund is taken to the heavenly home/mansion of his grandparents and likewise observes their youthful
appearance:
            I walked up to the house, and there was my grandfather, sitting on the front porch-and my
      grandmother was there, too. The house was their heavenly home! I remember falling down on my knees
      and saying, “Grandpa.” When he stood up, I noticed that he looked like he was only in his late twenties or
      early thirties. When he’d died, he’d been ninety-seven. Now, he was in perfect health, and so was
      Grandma. (pp. 42-43)

        The logical inference is that his grandmother had become a beautiful young woman and his grandfather a
handsome young man. These heavenly soulmates had their youth and vigor restored and were living together in
the same heavenly home as an attractive couple! As a passing comment, Sigmund notes a home being prepared for
another heavenly couple: “There were some homes still under construction. One of them had names carved in beautiful
letters above the entrance. These names were Paul and Judy of the family Hegstrom. At that time, I didn’t know who
they were, and I didn’t have the nerve to ask” (p. 59). Paul and Judy Hegstrom were a couple having a singular heavenly
mansion prepared for them. The circumstantial evidence would lead one to suspect that since these heavenly soulmates
would have their youthful vigor and beauty restored and would be living in the same home and be in heaven, where
according to others sexual desire still exists, these restored couples would have their sexual desire and sexual intimacy
restored in Heaven as well. The most reasonable conclusion, then, from such NDEs is that sex continues in Heaven.
        If there is sex in Heaven, how about in Hell? When taken on a tour of Hell by the Lord, Sigmund describes people
being raped, apparently by demons:

      rocks, and the demons would take the parts and eat them and pass them through. And then the body was

        Sigmund says that these people had flesh of some kind. His reference to skeletons suggest bones of some kind. So
how do we reconcile this claim by Sigmund with the statement by the resurrected Christ: “A spirit does not have flesh
and bones as you see I have” (Lk 24:39). One possibility is to pose that spirits have flesh and bones of some kind, but not
of the kind that the disciples perceived the Lord Jesus as having in His resurrected body. His flesh and bones were not
translucent, for example. So this part of Sigmund’s testimony may not be outside the range of possibility. As to people
being raped, Sigmund does not specify that people were raping one another, so the presence of sex organs is not
necessarily inferred. Astral rape is an energy rape that does not require sex organs, for instance. However, those in an
astral body can reputedly form the desired sex organ if they so desire. So the absence of sex organs cannot be assumed.
                                                    Howard Storm
      Storm describes his OBE and descent into Hell and being delivered from Hell by Jesus. Frankly, I discount the
genuineness of his alleged encounter with Christ. A fallen angel impersonating Christ seems a more reasonable
hypothesis for his particular experience. Nevertheless, Storm’s description of his own body might be genuine:

         I squeezed my fists and was amazed how much I was feeling in my hands just by making a fist. I could
         feel the bones in my hands, the muscles expand and contract, skin pressed against skin. I touched my
         body with my hands in several places and everything was intact, alive. My head, shoulders, arms, abdomen,
         and thighs were all intact. I pinched myself and it hurt.65

       Some type of flesh and bones that felt very real to his own touch seems reasonable. Harmonizing with Jesus’
statement in Lk 24:39 does not seem to be very difficult. Storm felt very real to himself and to others in the spiritual
dimension. But if he had appeared while in that spiritual body to those who were still in their physical bodies, they might
have perceived him as being a spirit, with a ghostly body. Our 3D bodies are perceived as phantom bodies by those in
4D bodies, and their 4D bodies are perceived as phantom bodies by those in 3D bodies. A resurrected body is able to
transverse both dimensions and appear as a solid body to those in both 3D and 4D bodies. Therefore, the disciples
perceived Jesus as having a physical body, with physical flesh and bones, rather than as a phantom body, with phantom
flesh and bones.
                                                    George G. Ritchie
       When Ritchie found himself outside of his body in his NDE, he described the phantom phenomena that would
happen when 3D and 4D bodies meet. His 4D body could pass right through someone in a 3D body, and they were not
even aware of it. This phenomenon is a common OBE. However, his describing a partially similar experience among
those in 4D bodies in hell is at odds with the standard descriptions by Sigmund and Storm, for example:

                 At first I thought we were looking at some great battlefield: everywhere people were locked in what
         looked like fights to the death, writhing, punching, gouging. It couldn’t be a present day war because there
         were no tanks or guns. No weapons of any sort, I saw as I looked closer, only bare hands and feet and teeth.
         And then I noticed that no one was apparently being injured. There was no blood, no bodies strewed the
         ground; a blow that ought to have eliminated an opponent would leave him exactly as before.
                 Although they appeared to be literally on top of each other, it was as though each man was boxing
         the air; at last I realized that of course, having no substance, they could not actually touch one another.

         so they hurled themselves at each other in a frenzy of impotent rage.

         watched consisted in being chained to a physical world of which we were no longer part. Now I saw that
         there were other kinds of chains. Here were no solid objects or people to enthrall the soul. These creatures
         seemed locked into habits of mind and emotion, into hatted, lust, destructive thought-patterns.
                 Even more hideous than the bites and kicks they exchanged, were the sexual abuses many were
         performing in feverish pantomime. Perversions I had never dreamed of were being vainly attempted
         all around us.66

but not actually touch one another. Ritchie’s phantom explanation as to why this is the case is not fully satisfying. He
simply attributes their inability rape to the nature of their bodies as “having no substance,” thus being spiritual bodies.
Yet those in 4D bodies in Heaven could hug one another even though they have spiritual bodies. They could touch and
hug one another even while in a spiritual state, having no physical substance. So why is it that those in Hell could not
interact with one another in this manner? Both those in Heaven and Hell would have been in spiritual bodies, that is, 4D

but those in Hell, whom Ritchie observed, could not? I would postulate that there are different spheres of torment in hell.

type of agony described by Ritchie.
        Spiritual rape was taking place in the compartment of hell that Sigmund observed: Demons were raping humans—
demonic rape. Phantom rape was taking place in the compartment of hell that Ritchie observed: People were vainly
attempting to rape one another—human rape. Perhaps all actualized sex in hell will be demonic rape, and all vainly
attempted human rape will be phantom rape. In any case, all sex in Hell will be hellish. Given that illicit sex of some type
is probably occurring at various levels in hell, is it not reasonable to think that licit sex probably occurs in Heaven? Is
sex limited to hell? Hardly. Therein sex is abused, used to intimidate. In Heaven, sex is unabused, used to intimate. Sex
is good. Indeed, after God created the woman as the sexual partner for the man, He said that what He created was very
good (Gen 1:31). The good things that God has created will not be swept away by sin or left in the domain of sin. Sex
will be redeemed, along with the rest of creation, to the glory of God. The lawful sexual intimacy that we experience now
is but a foretaste of the heavenly sexual intimacy that awaits believers—if they are faithful.
                                                           Conclusion
        Some of those claiming to have been to Heaven testify that sexual attraction still exists in Heaven, and in some
cases, those who have been married on Earth are said to be living together as companions in the same Heavenly mansion.
Sexual intimacy in such cases is implicitly inferred as taking place in Heaven during the intermediate state. Illicit sex is
explicitly confirmed to be occurring in Hell by some NDErs who have been there. A somewhat symmetrical relationship
between sex in Heaven and Hell might be posed. Not all those who live in Heaven will qualify for sexual intimacy. Not
all those who are confined in Hell will be subjected to sexual torment. Since rewards are according to our works, both
for those in Heaven and Hell, an analogous symmetrical correlation between the two is not entirely surprising. As a
general rule, those who have been faithful sexually can be expected to be rewarded sexually, and those who have been
unfaithful sexually can be expected to be punished sexually. Hellish sex is the negative inverse of heavenly sex.
Conversely, heavenly sex is the positive inverse of hellish sex. In summary, sex can either be a reward or a punishment.
If hellish sex is worse than abusive earthly sex, then will not heavenly sex be better than permissive earthly sex?
        Earthly sex is designed to fulfil at least two functions—reproduction and pleasure—and is thus split in its function.
Only half of its design is for the purpose of pleasure. Heavenly sex, in contrast, on the part of the resurrected, is not
designed for reproduction but solely for pleasure, intimacy being one form of that pleasure. Consequently, a rudimentary
calculation would anticipate that heavenly sex would be at least twice as pleasurable as earthly sex since heavenly sex is
not split in its function between pleasure and reproduction. We will consider more sophisticated calculations shortly.67
For now it suffices to conclude that if heavenly rewards are greater than earthly rewards—and if sexual intimacy with
one’s spouse is one such earthly reward—then surely heavenly sex with one’s companion will be greater than earthly
sex.

                    Biblical and Extrabiblical Confirmation
                                                      Introduction
       Heiser’s book, The Unseen Realm, is a scholastic presentation of his doctoral thesis, the catalyst of which is the
statement in Ps 82:1: “God [Elohim] stands in the divine assembly; He judges among the gods [elohim]” (TM).68 The
God of the OT is pictured as standing in the midst of pantheon of other OT gods. These other gods are archangels, a
council of high ranking angels. Angel means messenger. Angels designated as gods (elohim) have higher-level roles of
authority and responsibilities in the angelic hierarchy. The angels at the top of this hierarchy are archangels. These
archangels are also called sons of God (Gen 6:2,4; Job 1:6; 2:1; 38:7). Therefore, the sons of God are never simply called
angels in the Hebrew Scripture because these divine sons are higher ranking angels. Notwithstanding, they are angelic
sons of God. They are called sons in the familial sense because, according to Heiser, God created them and in this sense.
God parented them: “Because he [God] created them [archangels], he claims them as his sons, in the same way you
claim your children as your sons and daughters because you played a part in their creation” (p. 25).
                                                            Status
        From the outset, two problems are apparent in Heiser’s thesis. First, archangels are not the only angels that God
could claim as His children in this created sense. Why not call them children of God, if this created sense is the only
sense intended, since all angels are created by God? Unfortunately, Heiser does not address this question, even though
he acknowledges that Israel is God’s son (Ex 4:22; Hos 11:1) and this designation as God’s sons/children is applicable
to all believers (Gal 3:26), not just male believers (p. 156). Even so, an answer consistent with his thesis and the NT
distinction is that the expression sons of God is being used in this capacity to show elevated status.69 In the NT, all
believers are children of God (Rom 8:16; Gal 4:28), and in terms of parentage they are also sons of God (Gal 3:26; 4:27);
nevertheless, in terms of rank not all believers qualify as worthy to be called sons of God (Mt 5:9; Lk 20:36; Rom 8:14,19;
Heb 12:8; cp. Mt 5:44-46; Lk 6:32-35). The first two of these passages will suffice for the present discussion:

     •   “Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God” (Mt 5:9).
     •   And Jesus said to them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage, but those who are
         considered worthy to merit that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in
         marriage; for neither can they die anymore, for they are like angels, and are sons of God, being sons of
         the resurrection.”70 (Lk 20:34-36; TM)

        One of the rewards awaiting the sons of God in the Beatitudes is inheriting the Earth (Mt 5:5). They are rewarded
with inheriting their Father’s land. They are rewarded with the world to come. Likewise, in the key passage under
discussion, “those to whom is given the reward of the world to come, and to come back from the dead, have no wives,
and are not married” (Lk 20:24; BBE). They are rulers of the world to come. They are not ruled by worldly matrimonial
laws.
        The second weakness in Heiser’s thesis is that he fails to consider what impact angelic sexuality might have upon
his distinction between archangels and angels. His statement above would lead one to suspect that just as we claim our
sons and daughters as our children, so God would claim archangels as His children. Yet He does not. Why does God
call them sons instead? Does He not have any female angelic children? Yet we know that He must have created female
angels per the analysis herein. Several possible answers come to mind.
        First, perhaps all archangels are male. So God calls them sons rather than the sexually ambiguous children. If this
is the case, then in the angelic hierarchy the top position is limited to male angles. This might explain, in part, why Adam,
the male, was created first before Eve, the female counterpart. God created the male first because the sons of God are

male and have the highest rank. If so, then the archangels’ sexual counterparts might be lower ranking female angels.71
        A second possibility might be that the term sons is being used generically in relation to sex in order to show status
in relation to immature children. Paul does something very similar in Gal 4:1-6, where being children is contrasted with
being sons. In this second sense, all believers, both male and female, can qualify as sons. If this is the case, then the sons
of God, when used of archangels, might also be used generically in relation to sex. The weakness with this second
proposition is that the sons of God in Gen 6:2-4 are clearly male members of the divine council. They took human females
as their wives. A counter to this objection, however, would be that it makes sense that only the male sons of God would
have been involved in this particular action in that they were taking human wives for the purpose of procreation. Female
sons of God, if we call them that, using sons strictly in terms of rank, would presumably not be able to get pregnant. My
initial theory when I first started this book, in accordance with a popular assessment by Aquinas, was that angelic
daughters of God (i.e., female angels) and female archangels (if they exist) cannot procreate. Male angels could
impregnate human women and procreate through them, but female angels could not be impregnated by human men so as
to procreate through them.72 If this traditional theory is correct, then we may postulate that female archangels exist but
they were not included in the designation sons of God in Gen 6:2-4, so the designation son retains its male specificity in
this particular context. The male archangels are the only angels involved in this particular sin—taking human wives—
thus the expression sons of God is natural. Some would assume, wrongly, that female archangels were not involved in
this particular sin because they could not procreate with human males. Better hypotheses are needed. A traditional
supposition would leave open the question as to why only male archangels come before the Lord in Job 1:6 and 2:1.
Most likely, on such occasions, the designation, sons of God, loses its male distinctiveness and is used generically.
        If Heiser’s goal is to limit Gen 1:26 to the top echelon of angels, that is, to the sons of God, then sex is the Achilles
heel, or at least blind spot, of his presentation as it pertains to this text. He ignores the problem this deduction presents
for his thesis. If he actually believes that archangels are exclusively male, as he seems to assume, then his premises lead
to a disastrous conclusion for his thesis.
                                             Illustration 22. Heiser’s Dilemma
      1. God creates male and female humans in the image of archangels.
      2. Archangels are sons of God and thus exclusively male.
      3. Therefore, humans cannot be created as male and female in the image of archangels.

The conclusion of his argument, if he had followed it through to its logical conclusion, would have destroyed the heart
of his thesis. This shortcoming in Heiser’s argument need not be fatal to his thesis that the sons of God in the OT refer to
the divine council, however, as already suggested by the options above. For the thesis of the present book, which is that
humans were created in the image of angels as male and female, another possibility might be entertained, namely, that
Heiser was wrong in trying to limit Gen 1:26 to the highest ranking angels. Either Gen 1:26 is not limited to the sons of
God, but is talking about angels in general, or the sons of God are not limited to male angels. Gen 1:26 does not specify
that the Lord is speaking to the sons of God. Even so, a survey of texts that explicitly talks about the sons of God is in
order. Thus we will follow the path blazed by Heiser regarding these archangels and see where it may lead.
                                                 Sons of God and Gods

[Elohim] stands in the divine assembly; He judges among the gods [elohim].... I said, ‘You are gods [elohim], and all of
you are sons of the Most High [ben Elyon]. Nevertheless, you will die like men, and fall like any one of the princes”
(Ps 82:1,6-7; TM). These corrupt sons of God, or at least some of them, are sentenced to experience corporal punishment
in the form of physical death, which for them is an unnatural death. Obviously, this reference to gods cannot be members

        Heiser argues in ch. 5 of his book that the divine council is the reference of the plural in Gen 1:26, which is
plausible, but he acknowledges in his next chapter, that is, ch. 6 (p. 46), that the OT divine council is three-tiered: (1) God,

addresses the sexual correspondence most naturally in Gen 1:26, a point Heiser does not make. He acknowledges that
the humans are not the only ones created in the image of God. Nonhumans, that is, divine beings also share this status
(p. 52). Accordingly, to be consistent with its translation of Gen 3:5 (etc.) as referring to the possibility of Eve becoming
like divine beings [i.e., gods and goddesses] who know good and bad (TKN), the Tanakh should have translated

created him; male and female He created them” (TM).74 Being created in the image of God is presumably not limited to
the sons of God (i.e., archangels) but would also include the lower ranking angels, which would be another point in favor
of applying the plural of Gen 1:26 to all angels.
        To err is human, but it is also a trait shared by angels. God is not able to fully trust His image bearers, either divine
or human: “Can mankind be just before God? Can a man be pure before his Maker? He puts no trust even in His servants;
and He charges error against His angels” (Job 4:17-18; TM).”75 Even heavenly angels err, so the heavenly realm is not
error free: “Behold, He puts no trust in His holy angels [lit. holy ones], and the heavens are not pure in His sight”
(Job 15:15; TM).76 I can allow the plausibility of this part of Heiser’s argument because making mistakes is not
necessarily equatable with sin. One can be sincere, but be sincerely wrong, yet being sincerely wrong is not necessarily
sin. Even in Heaven one still can make mistakes and miss the mark.77 Trying to define sin simplistically in terms of
classical Greek as missing a mark is imprudent. We will not all be able to hit a hole-in-one on every shot while playing
golf in Heaven. Missing the mark will not mean that we have sinned. Sinless students in Heaven trying to solve complex
